sameAnalysis.word_list: energy, force, power, might, strength, vigour
means: energy ： 用于人时，指工作时焕发出的精力或干劲。
force ： 着重指克服障碍，推动人或物朝所要求的方向运动或能产生明显效应的力量。
power ： 最普通用词，泛指一切力量或能力等。
might ： 多指巨大或超人的力量。
strength ： 指机体内部的能力，是依靠身体组织而存在的力，经使用就变为force。
vigour ： 指由生命元气的存在所产生的活力、精力。

sentence.Network_en: I thought you might like to read the enclosed.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想你或许想要读一下信封里的内容。

sentence.Network_en: Today I might hesitate to turn in a burglar.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在让我把入室窃贼送交警方，我可能会有所顾虑。

sentence.Network_en: Things might have been different if I'd talked a bit more.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果当时我再多说一点的话，结果或许会不一样。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to make an unenthusiastic suggestion
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于非积极性建议］倒不如；（满）可以

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that a situation is the same as if the hypothetical thing stated were true
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于表示情况相同，就好像所述假设是真的］就如同，会和…一样

lj.lj_ly: for readers seeking illumination, this book might as well have been written in Serbo-Croatian.

jx.jx_en_mean: used to express one's lack of surprise about something
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于表示对某事不感到惊奇］就知道

lj.lj_ly: I might have known it was you.

jx.jx_en_mean: those who are powerful can do what they wish unchallenged, even if their action is in fact unjustified
using all one's power or strength
with all one's strength or power

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English miht, mieht, of Germanic origin; related to may

entry.def: You use might to indicate that something will possibly happen or be true in the future, but you cannot be certain.

example.ex: Smoking might be banned totally in most buildings...
example.tran: 绝大多数建筑中可能会全面禁止吸烟。

example.ex: The two countries might go to war...
example.tran: 两国有可能交战。

entry.def: You use might to indicate that there is a possibility that something is true, but you cannot be certain.

example.ex: She and Simon's father had not given up hope that he might be alive...
example.tran: 她和西蒙的父亲还没有放弃他或许还活着的希望。

example.ex: You might be right...
example.tran: 你或许是对的。

entry.def: You use might to indicate that something could happen or be true in particular circumstances.

example.ex: America might sell more cars to the islands if they were made with the steering wheel on the right.
example.tran: 如果制造的汽车方向盘是装在右边的，美国可能会在这些岛屿卖出更多的汽车。

example.ex: ...the type of person who might appear in a fashion  magazine.
example.tran: 那种可能会登上时装杂志的人

entry.tran: 可能(表示已经发生或过去某件事可能属实，但不确定；有时用于对某事提供一种可能的解释)
entry.def: You use might have with a past participle to indicate that it is possible that something hap-pened or was true, or when giving a possible explanation for something.

example.ex: I heard what might have been an explosion...
example.tran: 我听见了一声巨响，可能是爆炸声。

example.ex: She thought the shooting might have been an accident...
example.tran: 她想这次枪击可能是一次意外。

entry.def: You use might have with a past participle to indicate that something was a possibility in the past, although it did not actually happen.

example.ex: If she had had to give up riding she might have taken up sailing competitively...
example.tran: 如果她当时不得不放弃骑自行车的话，她或许就从事她很有优势的帆船运动了。

example.ex: Had the bomb dropped over a populated area of the city, there might have been a great deal of damage...
example.tran: 如果炸弹投在了该市人口密集的地区，那损失就大了。

entry.tran: 可能，也许(表示虽然接受某一事实，但将其与更为重要的方面对比)
entry.def: You use might in statements where you are accepting the truth of a situation, but contrasting it with something that is more important.

example.ex: He might be a bore, but he was as quick-witted as a weasel...
example.tran: 他也许是个很无聊的人，可是却像黄鼠狼一样机灵。

example.ex: They might not have two cents to rub together, but at least they have a kind of lifestyle that is different.
example.tran: 他们也许穷得叮当响，但他们至少拥有一种不同的生活方式。

entry.tran: 应该(强调某人应该做某事，尤指对某人未做某事感到气愤)
entry.def: You use might when you are saying emphatically that someone ought to do the thing mentioned, especially when you are annoyed because they have not done it.

example.ex: And while I'm out you might clean up the kitchen...
example.tran: 我不在的时候，你打扫一下厨房总该可以吧。

example.ex: You might have told me that before!
example.tran: 你之前应该告诉我那件事情！

entry.tran: 可以，不妨(用于委婉提出建议或忠告)
entry.def: You use might to make a suggestion or to give advice in a very polite way.

example.ex: They might be wise to stop advertising on television...
example.tran: 他们不妨停止在电视上做广告，这样做可能是明智之举。

example.ex: You might try the gas station down the street...
example.tran: 你可以到街那头的加油站试试。

entry.tran: 可不可以，能否(用于礼貌地打断别人、提出问题、做出请求或引出接下来要说的话)
entry.def: You use might as a polite way of interrupting someone, asking a question, making a request, or introducing what you are going to say next.

example.ex: Might I make a suggestion?...
example.tran: 我能否提个建议？

example.ex: Might I ask what you're doing here?...
example.tran: 我可不可以问一下，您在这里干什么？

entry.tran: （表示接下来的陈述并不令人惊讶）可以，能够(预料)
entry.def: You use might in expressions such as as you might expect and as you might imagine in order to indicate that the statement you are making is not surprising.

example.ex: 'How's Jan?' she asked. — 'Bad. As you might expect.'...
example.tran: “简怎么样？”她问道。——“如你所料，情况不好。”

example.ex: The drivers, as you might imagine, didn't care much for that.
example.tran: 和想象中的一样，这些司机对此并不太在意。

entry.tran: 我可以这么说(表示强调接下来的陈述)
entry.def: You use might in expressions such as I might add and I might say in order to emphasize a statement that you are making.

example.ex: Relatives ring up constantly, not always for the best motives, I might add...
example.tran: 亲戚们不断打电话过来，不客气地说，他们并非全都出于最好的动机。

example.ex: It didn't come as a great surprise to me, I might say.
example.tran: 可以这么说，这并没有令我大吃一惊。

entry.tran: 我早该知道/我早该猜到(表示对某件令人失望的事情或情况并不吃惊)
entry.def: You use might in expressions such as I might have known and I might have guessed to indicate that you are not surprised at a disappointing event or fact.

example.ex: I might have known I'd find you with some little slut...
example.tran: 我早该知道你会跟哪个小娼妇在一起。

example.ex: 'I detest clutter, you know.' — 'I didn't know, but I might have guessed.'
example.tran: “我特别厌恶杂乱无章，你是知道的。”——“我可不知道，不过我早该猜到了。”

example.ex: The might of the army could prove a decisive factor.
example.tran: 军事力量可能会成为决定性的因素。

entry.def: If you do something with all your might, you do it using all your strength and energy.

example.ex: She swung the hammer at his head with all her might.
example.tran: 她使出全身力气抡起榔头砸向他的脑袋。

sentences.en: He might get here in time, but I can't be sure.
sentences.cn: 他可能及时来到这里, 不过我不能确定。

means.word_mean: 用于婉转的请求或吁请

sentences.en: I think you might at least offer to help?
sentences.cn: 我认为你至少可以主动帮忙吧?

means.word_mean: 力气, 力量, 威力, 权力

sentences.en: I pushed the rock with all my might.

jushi.english: Try as I might,I couldn't lift the stone.
jushi.chinese: 无论我使多大的劲,也举不起这块石头。

jushi.english: I think you might at least offer to help?
jushi.chinese: 我认为你至少可以主动帮忙吧?
